name: Core\FormHelper
short_desc: Contains functions for building form elements of various types.

appendErrorClass.name: appendErrorClass
appendErrorClass.short_desc: Adds name of error classes to div associated with a form field.
appendErrorClass.hint_desc: $attrs Div attributes with error classes added.

attrs.name: attrs
attrs.short_desc:
The values used to set the class and other
attributes of the input string.  The default value is an empty array.

name.name: name
name.short_desc: The name of the field associated with this error.

class.name: class
class.short_desc:
Name of the class used to identify errors for a
form field.

button.name: button
button.short_desc:
Supports ability to create a styled button.  Supports ability to have
functions for event handlers.
button.long_desc:
An example function call is shown below:
FormHelper::button("Click Me!", ['class' => 'btn btn-large btn-primary', 'onClick' => 'alert(\'Hello World!\')']);

Example HTML output is shown below:
<button type="button"  class="btn btn-large btn-primary" onClick="alert('Hello World!')">Click Me!</button>
button.hint_desc:
An HTML button element with its label set and any other
optional attributes set.

buttonText.name: buttonText
buttonText.short_desc: The contents of the button's label.

inputAttrs.name: inputAttrs
inputAttrs.short_desc:
The values used to set the class and other
attributes of the input string.  The default value is an empty array.

buttonBlock.name: buttonBlock
buttonBlock.short_desc:
Supports ability to create a styled button and styled surrounding div
block.  Supports ability to have functions for event handlers".
buttonBlock.long_desc: An example function call is shown below: FormHelper::buttonBlock("Click Me!", ['class' => 'btn btn-large btn-primary', 'onClick' => 'alert(\'Hello World!\')'], ['class' => 'form-group']); Example HTML output is shown below:
buttonBlock.hint_desc:
An HTML div surrounding a button element with its label
set and any other optional attributes set.

buttonText.name: buttonText
buttonText.short_desc: The contents of the button's label.

inputAttrs.name: inputAttrs
inputAttrs.short_desc:
The values used to set the class and other
attributes of the input string.  The default value is an empty array.

divAttrs.name: divAttrs
divAttrs.short_desc:
The values used to set the class and other
attributes of the surrounding div.  The default value is an empty array.

checkboxBlockLabelLeft.name: checkboxBlockLabelLeft
checkboxBlockLabelLeft.short_desc:
Generates a div containing an input of type checkbox with the label to
the left.
checkboxBlockLabelLeft.long_desc: An example function call is shown below: FormHelper::checkboxBlockLabelRight('Remember Me', 'remember_me', 'on', $this->login->getRememberMeChecked(), [], ['class' => 'form-group'], $this->displayErrors); Example HTML output is shown below:
checkboxBlockLabelLeft.hint_desc: A surrounding div and the input element of type checkbox.

label.name: label
label.short_desc: Sets the label for this input.

name.name: name
name.short_desc:
Sets the value for the name, for, and id attributes
for this input.

value.name: value
value.short_desc:
The value we want to set.  We can use this to set
the value of the value attribute during form validation.  Default value
is the empty string.  It can be set with values during form validation
and forms used for editing records.

checked.name: checked
checked.short_desc:
The value for the checked attribute.  If true
this attribute will be set as checked="checked".  The default value is
false.  It can be set with values during form validation and forms
used for editing records.

inputAttrs.name: inputAttrs
inputAttrs.short_desc:
The values used to set the class and other
attributes of the input string.  The default value is an empty array.

divAttrs.name: divAttrs
divAttrs.short_desc:
The values used to set the class and other
attributes of the surrounding div.  The default value is an empty array.

errors.name: errors
errors.short_desc: The errors array.  Default value is an empty array.

checkboxBlockLabelRight.name: checkboxBlockLabelRight
checkboxBlockLabelRight.short_desc:
Generates a div containing an input of type checkbox with the label to
the right.
checkboxBlockLabelRight.long_desc: An example function call is shown below: FormHelper::checkboxBlockLabelRight('Remember Me', 'remember_me', 'on', $this->login->getRememberMeChecked(), [], ['class' => 'form-group mr-1'], $this->displayErrors); Example HTML output is shown below:
checkboxBlockLabelRight.hint_desc: A surrounding div and the input element.

label.name: label
label.short_desc: Sets the label for this input.

name.name: name
name.short_desc:
Sets the value for the name, for, and id attributes
for this input.

value.name: value
value.short_desc:
The value we want to set.  We can use this to set
the value of the value attribute during form validation.  Default value
is the empty string.  It can be set with values during form validation
and forms used for editing records.

checked.name: checked
checked.short_desc:
The value for the checked attribute.  If true
this attribute will be set as checked="checked".  The default value is
false.  It can be set with values during form validation and forms

inputAttrs.name: inputAttrs
inputAttrs.short_desc:
The values used to set the class and other
attributes of the input string.  The default value is an empty array.

errors.name: errors
errors.short_desc: The errors array.  Default value is an empty array.

checkToken.name: checkToken
checkToken.short_desc:
Checks if the csrf token exists.  This is used to verify that there has
been no tampering of a form's csrf token.
checkToken.hint_desc:
The result of the AND operation on whether or not a token
exists with a session and if the session's token is equal to the value
of the $token parameter.

token.name: token
token.short_desc:
The token string we will test whether or not it
exists.

csrfInput.name: csrfInput
csrfInput.short_desc: A hidden input to represent the csrf token in a web form.
csrfInput.long_desc:
Example HTML output is shown below:
<input type="hidden" name="csrf_token" id="csrf_token" value="RANDOM_STRING_OF_VALUES" />
csrfInput.hint_desc:
The hidden input of type hidden with the generated token
set as the value.

displayErrors.name: displayErrors
displayErrors.hint_desc:
A string representation of a div element containing an
input of type checkbox.

errors.name: errors
errors.short_desc:
A list of errors and their description that is
generated during server side form validation.

emailBlock.name: emailBlock
emailBlock.short_desc: Renders an HTML div element that surrounds an input of type email.
emailBlock.long_desc:
An example function call is shown below:
FormHelper::emailBlock('Email', 'email', $this->contact->email, ['class' => 'form-control'], ['class' => 'form-group col-md-6'], $this->displayErrors);

Example HTML output is shown below:
<label for="email">Email</label><input type="email" id="email" name="email" value="" class="form-control" placeholder="joe_@_example.com" />
emailBlock.hint_desc: A surrounding div and the input element of type email.

label.name: label
label.short_desc: Sets the label for this input.

name.name: name
name.short_desc:
Sets the value for the name, for, and id attributes
for this input.

value.name: value
value.short_desc:
The value we want to set.  We can use this to set
the value of the value attribute during form validation.  Default value
is the empty string.  It can be set with values during form validation
and forms used for editing records.

inputAttrs.name: inputAttrs
inputAttrs.short_desc:
The values used to set the class and other
attributes of the input string.  The default value is an empty array.

divAttrs.name: divAttrs
divAttrs.short_desc:
The values used to set the class and other
attributes of the surrounding div.  The default value is an empty array.

errors.name: errors
errors.short_desc: The errors array.  Default value is an empty array.

errorMsg.name: errorMsg
errorMsg.short_desc: Renders an error message for a particular form field.
errorMsg.hint_desc: The error message for a particular field.

name.name: name
name.short_desc: Used to search errors array for key/form field.

generateToken.name: generateToken
generateToken.short_desc: Creates a randomly generated csrf token.

hidden.name: hidden
hidden.long_desc:
An example function call is shown below:
FormHelper::hidden("example_name", "example_value");

Example HTML output is shown below:
<input type="hidden" name="example_name" id="example_name" value="example_value" />
hidden.hint_desc: The html input element with type hidden.

name.name: name
name.short_desc: The value for the name and id attributes.

value.name: value
value.short_desc: The value for the value attribute.

inputBlock.name: inputBlock
inputBlock.short_desc:
Assists in the development of forms input blocks in forms.  It accepts
parameters for setting attribute tags in the form section.  Not to be
used for inputs of type "Submit"  For submit inputs use the submitBlock
or submitTag functions.
inputBlock.long_desc: Types of inputs supported: 1. color 2. date 3. datetime-local 4. email 5. file 6. month 7. number 8. password 9. range 10. search 11. tel 12. text 13. time 14. url 15. week An example function call is shown below: FormHelper::inputBlock('text', 'Example', 'example_name', example_value, ['class' => 'form-control'], ['class' => 'form-group'], $this->displayErrors); Example HTML output is shown below:
inputBlock.hint_desc: A surrounding div and the input element.

type.name: type
type.short_desc: The input type we want to generate.

label.name: label
label.short_desc: Sets the label for this input.

name.name: name
name.short_desc:
Sets the value for the name, for, and id attributes
for this input.

value.name: value
value.short_desc:
The value we want to set.  We can use this to set
the value of the value attribute during form validation.  Default value
is the empty string.  It can be set with values during form validation
and forms used for editing records.

inputAttrs.name: inputAttrs
inputAttrs.short_desc:
The values used to set the class and other
attributes of the input string.  The default value is an empty array.

divAttrs.name: divAttrs
divAttrs.short_desc:
The values used to set the class and other
attributes of the surrounding div.  The default value is an empty array.

errors.name: errors
errors.short_desc: The errors array.  Default value is an empty array.

optionsForSelect.name: optionsForSelect
optionsForSelect.hint_desc: The HTML element for select with correct value displayed.

options.name: options
options.short_desc: An array of options for the select.

output.name: output
output.long_desc:
An example function call is shown below:
FormHelper::output("my_name", "for_value")

Example HTML output is shown below:
<output name="my_name" for="for_value"></output>

name.name: name
name.short_desc:
Sets the value for the name attributes for this
input.

for.name: for
for.short_desc: Sets the value for the for attribute.

posted_values.name: posted_values
posted_values.short_desc: Performs sanitization of values obtained during $_POST.
posted_values.hint_desc: An array of sanitized values from the submitted form.

post.name: post
post.short_desc:
Values from the $_POST superglobal array when the
user submits a form.

radioInput.name: radioInput
radioInput.short_desc:
Creates an input element of type radio with an accompanying label
element.  Compatible with radio button groups.
radioInput.long_desc: An example function call is shown below: FormHelper::radioInput('HTML', 'html', 'fav_language', "HTML", $check1, ['class' => 'form-group mr-1']); FormHelper::radioInput('CSS', 'css', 'fav_language', "CSS", $check2, ['class' => 'form-group mr-1']); Example HTML output is shown below:
radioInput.hint_desc: The HTML input element of type radio.

label.name: label
label.short_desc: Sets the label for this input.

id.name: id
id.short_desc: The id attribute for the radio input element.

name.name: name
name.short_desc:
Sets the value for the name attribute
for this input.

value.name: value
value.short_desc:
The value we want to set.  We can use this to set
the value of the value attribute during form validation.  It can be
set with values during form validation and forms used for editing records.

checked.name: checked
checked.short_desc:
The value for the checked attribute.  If true
this attribute will be set as checked="checked".  The default value is
false.  It can be set with values during form validation and forms
used for editing records.

inputAttrs.name: inputAttrs
inputAttrs.short_desc:
The values used to set the class and other
attributes of the input string.  The default value is an empty array.

sanitize.name: sanitize
sanitize.short_desc: Sanitizes potentially harmful string of characters.
sanitize.hint_desc: The sanitized version of the dirty string.

selectBlock.name: selectBlock
selectBlock.short_desc: Renders a select element with a list of options.
selectBlock.long_desc: An example function call is shown below: FormHelper::selectBlock("Test", "test", $_POST["test"],['A' => 'a','B' => 'b', 'C' => 'c'], ['class' => 'form-control'], ['class' => 'form-group'], $this->displayErrors); Example HTML output is shown below:
selectBlock.hint_desc: A surrounding div and option select element.

label.name: label
label.short_desc: Sets the label for this input.

name.name: name
name.short_desc:
Sets the value for the name, for, and id attributes
for this input.

value.name: value
value.short_desc: The value we want to set as selected.

options.name: options
options.short_desc:
The list of options we will use to populate the
select option dropdown.  The default value is an empty array.

inputAttrs.name: inputAttrs
inputAttrs.short_desc:
The values used to set the class and other
attributes of the input string.  The default value is an empty array.

The values used to set the class and other
attributes of the surrounding div.  The default value is an empty array.

errors.name: errors
errors.short_desc: The errors array.  Default value is an empty array.

attrs.name: attrs
attrs.short_desc: The attributes we want to stringify.

submitBlock.name: submitBlock
submitBlock.short_desc: Generates a div containing an input of type submit.
submitBlock.long_desc: An example function call is shown below: FormHelper::submitBlock("Save", ['class'=>'btn btn-primary'], ['class'=>'text-end']); Example HTML output is shown below:
errors: The method "submitBlock" has "4" @param tags but only "3" where expected.

button.

inputAttrs.name: inputAttrs

The values used to set the class and other
attributes of the input string.  The default value is an empty array.

telBlock.name: telBlock
telBlock.short_desc: Renders an HTML div element that surrounds an input of type tel.
telBlock.hint_desc:
The HTML div element surrounding an input of type tel
with configuration and values set based on parameters entered during
function call.

textareaBlock.short_desc:
Assists in the development of textarea in forms.  It accepts parameters
for setting  attribute tags in the form section.

errors: The method "textareaBlock" has "7" @param tags but only "6" where expected.
